About KVLS

Membership
Membership
Member Dues are due by April 1, 2025
of
Transcript
KVLS Online Membership survey & dues
https://www.osceolacountyfair.com/f/142
2025--2026 Membership renewal survey
History
Originally founded early in the 1940's, the
Kissimmee Livestock Market
was quickly interrupted by the events of WWII. However, in 1944, our organization returned when a group of community visionaries officially signed articles of incorporation, re-branding under president Frank Poffenbaugh as the
Kissimmee Valley Livestock Show and Fair Association
. Twenty founding members supported an organization dedicated to educational development, commerce, industry, and agriculture in the Osceola County and Kissimmee Valley areas.  These principals have been facilitated throughout the years in the form of fairs, livestock shows, and local purebred livestock sales. KVLS was established on the belief of the importance of youth development, and has realized such through involvement with 4-H and Future Farmers of America organizations. We, at the Kissimmee Valley Livestock Show and Fair Association, have always had a strong commitment to the vision of our founders and will continue to through dedication to our members, facilities, and volunteers.
of
Transcript
Today
Today, The Kissimmee Valley Livestock Show has more than 200 supporting members who continue to dedicate themselves to the mission of our founders.  Throughout the year, members work together to plan and coordinate the Oscecola County Fair, our annual 10 day event held each February. Their commitment to the fair, along with additional agriculture shows and educational events, maintains the KVLS Show Pavilion. Because of its members, this outstanding facility is host to shows and events such as the Osceola County Extension Master Gardeners’ Semi-Annual Plant Sale, the University of Florida Small Farms Conference, and the Junior Florida Cattlemen’s Association Beef Show, along with various meetings, parties, and weddings throughout the year.
of
Transcript
What We Do
The work of a KVLS member is never done! Committee Chairmen and their teams constantly search for new and exciting opportunities for Osceola County youth who find themselves interested in agriculture, one of our nation’s top industries, while simultaneously acknowledging the value of top entertainment at an affordable price to Central Florida Families. Members, along side a guiding Board of Directors, attend workshops, educational seminars, and trade shows in order to ensure we always have the best tools for the job.  Our members generously give back to their community, volunteering hours of time, seeking sponsorship, fundraising for scholarship programs, and supporting numerous youth and community programs in a variety of capacities.
of
Transcript
How to become a Member??
Membership in this organization is open to any resident of Osceola County, Florida, who is a qualified elector of Osceola County and who is interested in the objectives of the organization. The membership application process is detailed below:
Completed application- Any      member of KVLS may obtain a membership application from a KVLS Chairperson      for a proposed new member starting May 1. A completed application, along      with all signatures, must be submitted to (or postmarked) the KVLS office      by 5: 00 pm ET on the first (1st) Business Day in August of the current      year. No Late applications or incomplete applications will be accepted for      membership. The completed application must have signatures of KVLS member      sponsor and Committee Chairperson.
Along with the completed      application there is a non-refundable $30.00 application fee, to be      submitted or postmarked  by 3:00pm ET on the first (1st) Business Day      in August of the current year to the KVLS Office.
All applicants must provide      their full name, driver’s license number, voter ID number, and social      security number. This information will be used to do a background check.
Upon completed submission, the application will be presented to the Board of Directors. If a proposed member is approved by a majority of the Board, that person will become a member of KVLS.
of
Transcript

Contact/Directions
The Kissimmee Valley Livestock Show & Osceola County Fair are located inside Osceola Heritage Park.
1911 Kissimmee Valley Lane
Kissimmee, FL 34744
321-697-3050 phone
321-697-3060 fax
kvls@osceolacountyfair.com
Office Hours
April 1st - November  30th
Monday - Thursday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00p.m.
December 1st - March 31st
Monday - Friday, 9:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.
Directions
Osceola Heritage Park
is located one mile west of the Florida Turnpike exit 244 on Highway 192 in Kissimmee. Exit 242 from the south.
